metadata.title: PCP Theorem Formalization
metadata.description: Formalization plan for NP = PCP(log n, 1) following Dinur's gap amplification proof

nodes.name: PCP Definitions
nodes.description: Core PCP verifier definitions, oracle interface, PCP class predicate

nodes.name: Language Encodings
nodes.description: Bitstring encodings, input representations, SAT language definition

nodes.name: PCP(log n, 1) ⊆ NP
nodes.signature: theorem PCP_subset_NP : ∀ L, PCP (λ n, O(log n)) (λ _, O(1)) L → L ∈ NP
nodes.description: Trivial inclusion: enumerate all random strings and include proof bits in NP certificate

nodes.name: Constraint Graph Definitions
nodes.description: Binary CSP, assignments, satisfaction, UNSAT value

nodes.name: UNSAT Value
nodes.signature: def BinaryCSP.unsat {V α} [Fintype V] [Fintype α] (G : BinaryCSP V α) : ℚ
nodes.description: Minimum fraction of unsatisfied constraints over all assignments
nodes.notes: Uses finite maximization via [Fintype (V → α)]

nodes.name: 3-Colorability is NP-hard
nodes.signature: theorem threeColor_to_csp : 3Color ≤p (G ↦ (UNSAT(G)=0))
nodes.description: Reduction from 3-Colorability to 2-CSP satisfiability

nodes.name: Expander Graph Definitions
nodes.description: Combinatorial expansion, spectral gap, explicit families
nodes.notes: Major missing mathlib4 dependency - may need to port from Isabelle AFP

nodes.name: Cheeger's Inequality
nodes.signature: theorem cheeger_inequality : ∃ h, λ₁(G) ≤ d - h²/(2*d)
nodes.description: Relates spectral gap to edge expansion
nodes.notes: Core spectral graph theory - needs Rayleigh quotient formalization

nodes.name: Preprocess (Regularization + Expanderization)
nodes.signature: def preprocess {V α} [Fintype V] [Fintype α] (G : BinaryCSP V α) : Σ (V' : Type*) [Fintype V'], BinaryCSP V' α
nodes.description: Transform CSP into regular, expanding graph via vertex clouds and edge addition

nodes.name: Preprocessing Preserves UNSAT
nodes.signature: lemma preprocess_spec : ∃ λ d β₁, β₁*UNSAT(G) ≤ UNSAT(preprocess G) ≤ UNSAT(G) ∧ regular ∧ λ ≤ const
nodes.description: Preprocessing maintains UNSAT up to constant factor while achieving regularity and expansion

nodes.name: Graph Powering
nodes.signature: def power {V α} [Fintype V] [Fintype α] (t : ℕ) (G : BinaryCSP V α) : BinaryCSP V (Fin (Gdegree G) → α)
nodes.description: G^t with walk-based constraints; alphabet grows to tuples

nodes.name: Powering Amplifies UNSAT
nodes.signature: theorem powering_soundness : ∃ β₂>0, UNSAT(G^t) ≥ β₂ * √t * min (UNSAT(G)) (1/t)
nodes.description: Core gap amplification: powering increases UNSAT by ~√t
nodes.notes: HARDEST LEMMA - requires random walk mixing bounds and spectral inequalities

nodes.name: Assignment Tester Interface
nodes.description: Assignment tester structure with soundness and completeness properties

nodes.name: Composition Reduces Alphabet
nodes.signature: theorem composition_lemma : ∃ β₃>0 c, UNSAT(G ∘ P) ≥ β₃ * UNSAT(G) ∧ size ≤ c * size(G)
nodes.description: Composing CSP with assignment tester preserves UNSAT while reducing alphabet

nodes.name: Constant-Alphabet Tester Exists
nodes.signature: theorem tester_exists : ∃ P : AssignmentTester, Fintype.card P.Σ0 = O(1) ∧ P.ε ≥ ε0
nodes.description: Explicit construction via Long Code
nodes.notes: Decouplable module - can be treated as black box initially

nodes.name: Dinur Main Theorem
nodes.signature: theorem dinur_main : ∃ Σ0, ∀ Σ, ∃ C α∈(0,1), ∀ G, ∃ G', size(G') ≤ C*size(G) ∧ UNSAT(G') ≥ min(2*UNSAT(G), α)
nodes.description: Gap-doubling with linear size growth - combines preprocessing, powering, and composition

nodes.name: Gap-CSP ⇔ PCP(log n, O(1))
nodes.signature: theorem PCP_gapCSP_equiv : (NP ⊆ PCP(log, O(1))) ↔ (Gap-2CSP with constant gap is NP-hard)
nodes.description: Standard equivalence between PCP and Gap-CSP formulations

nodes.name: NP-hard Constant-Gap 2-CSP
nodes.signature: theorem gap2csp_hard : ∃ Σ0, NP-hard ({G | UNSAT(G)=0} vs UNSAT(G)≥α)
nodes.description: Iterate Dinur main theorem O(log n) times to boost gap to constant

nodes.name: NP = PCP(log n, 1)
nodes.signature: theorem PCP_theorem : NP = { L | PCP (λ n, O(log n)) (λ _, O(1)) L }
nodes.description: Final statement combining all pieces

nodes.name: Adjacency Matrix
nodes.signature: def adjacencyMatrix (G : SimpleGraph V) : Matrix V V ℚ
nodes.description: Adjacency matrix of a finite graph over rationals
nodes.notes: Use mathlib's Matrix library; define for undirected graphs

nodes.name: Graph Eigenvalues
nodes.signature: def eigenvalues (G : SimpleGraph V) : Multiset ℝ
nodes.description: Eigenvalues of the adjacency matrix, sorted by magnitude
nodes.notes: Requires spectral theorem for symmetric matrices

nodes.name: Rayleigh Quotient
nodes.signature: def rayleighQuotient (A : Matrix n n ℝ) (v : n → ℝ) : ℝ
nodes.description: Rayleigh quotient for characterizing eigenvalues

nodes.name: Second Eigenvalue vs Expansion
nodes.signature: lemma lambda2_expansion_bound : λ₂(G) ≤ d - h(G)²/(2*d)
nodes.description: Relates second eigenvalue to edge expansion (one direction of Cheeger)
nodes.notes: Core spectral inequality; uses Rayleigh quotient

nodes.name: Random Walk on Graph
nodes.signature: def randomWalk (G : Graph V) (t : ℕ) : V → V → ℚ
nodes.description: t-step random walk distribution on regular graph
nodes.notes: Discrete probability; use Fintype for finite state space

nodes.name: Spectral Mixing Lemma
nodes.signature: lemma spectral_mixing : ‖P^t - U‖ ≤ λ₂^t
nodes.description: Random walk converges to uniform exponentially fast in spectral gap
nodes.notes: Key for powering_soundness; requires operator norm bounds

nodes.name: Path Sampling Concentration
nodes.signature: lemma path_concentration : Pr[walks satisfy bad event] ≤ exp(-Ω(t))
nodes.description: Random t-step paths concentrate around expected values
nodes.notes: Uses Chernoff + independence; needed for powering analysis

nodes.name: Edge Expansion
nodes.signature: def edgeExpansion (G : Graph V) : ℚ
nodes.description: Minimum ratio of edges leaving a set to its size

nodes.name: Explicit Expander Family Exists
nodes.signature: theorem explicit_expanders : ∃ (family : ℕ → Graph), ∀ n, expands family(n) ∧ explicit
nodes.description: Constructive expander family (zig-zag or algebraic construction)
nodes.notes: HARD - may axiomatize or port from Isabelle AFP; zig-zag product is one route

nodes.name: Vertex Cloud Expansion (prep1)
nodes.signature: def prep1 (G : BinaryCSP V α) : BinaryCSP V' α
nodes.description: Replace each vertex with a cloud expander; add equality constraints

nodes.name: prep1 Preserves UNSAT
nodes.signature: lemma prep1_unsat : UNSAT(G) ≤ UNSAT(prep1 G) ≤ c₁ * UNSAT(G)
nodes.description: Vertex blow-up changes UNSAT by at most constant factor

nodes.name: Edge Expander Addition (prep2)
nodes.signature: def prep2 (G : BinaryCSP V α) : BinaryCSP V α
nodes.description: Add expander edges and self-loops to achieve spectral gap

nodes.name: Preprocessing Achieves Regularity
nodes.signature: lemma preprocess_regular : regular (preprocess G) d
nodes.description: Combined preprocessing produces d-regular graph

nodes.name: Linear Code
nodes.signature: structure LinearCode (F : Type*) [Field F] (n k : ℕ)
nodes.description: [n,k] linear code over field F with generator matrix
nodes.notes: May exist in mathlib or need basic formalization

nodes.name: Code Distance
nodes.signature: def distance (C : LinearCode F n k) : ℕ
nodes.description: Minimum Hamming distance between distinct codewords

nodes.name: Good Codes Exist
nodes.signature: theorem good_linear_codes : ∃ C : LinearCode F n k, distance C ≥ δ*n ∧ k ≥ (1-ε)*n
nodes.description: Linear codes with constant rate and relative distance exist (probabilistic or explicit)
nodes.notes: Gilbert-Varshamov or expander codes

nodes.name: Hadamard Code
nodes.signature: def hadamardCode (k : ℕ) : LinearCode F 2^k k
nodes.description: Hadamard/Walsh code: encode k bits to 2^k bits
nodes.notes: Used in assignment tester constructions

nodes.name: Long Code
nodes.signature: def longCode (f : Bool^k → Bool) : Bool^(2^k)
nodes.description: Encodes a function as its truth table

nodes.name: Long Code Linearity Test
nodes.signature: lemma long_code_test : far_from_long_code → reject_probability ≥ ε
nodes.description: Soundness of linearity test for Long Code
nodes.notes: Core of assignment tester; Fourier analysis on Boolean cube

nodes.name: Chernoff Bound
nodes.signature: lemma chernoff_bound : Pr[|X - 𝔼[X]| ≥ δ] ≤ 2*exp(-δ²*n/3)
nodes.description: Concentration of sum of independent random variables
nodes.notes: May exist in mathlib probability; key for random walk analysis

nodes.name: Union Bound
nodes.signature: lemma union_bound : Pr[⋃ᵢ Aᵢ] ≤ ∑ᵢ Pr[Aᵢ]
nodes.description: Basic probability union bound
nodes.notes: Should be in mathlib; include for completeness

nodes.name: Polynomial-Time Reduction
nodes.signature: def polyReduction (L₁ L₂ : Language) : Prop
nodes.description: L₁ ≤ₚ L₂ via polynomial-time computable function
nodes.notes: May exist in mathlib or need basic complexity theory setup

nodes.name: SAT Language
nodes.signature: def SAT : Language
nodes.description: Boolean satisfiability problem

nodes.name: SAT is NP-complete
nodes.signature: theorem sat_np_complete : SAT ∈ NP ∧ (∀ L ∈ NP, L ≤ₚ SAT)
nodes.description: Cook-Levin theorem
nodes.notes: Major theorem; may port from Isabelle or axiomatize initially

nodes.name: Walk-Based Constraint
nodes.signature: def walkConstraint (e : Edge) (t : ℕ) : Constraint (α^t)
nodes.description: Constraint checking consistency along t-step paths

nodes.name: Bad Assignment Structure
nodes.signature: lemma bad_assignment_concentration : assignments far from good → many violated walks
nodes.description: Assignments with high UNSAT have many violated random walks
nodes.notes: Key lemma for powering_soundness; uses random walk mixing

nodes.name: Typical Assignment
nodes.signature: def isTypical (G : BinaryCSP V α) (σ : Assignment V α) (δ : ℚ) : Prop
nodes.description: Assignment where local neighborhoods are mostly consistent
nodes.notes: Captures the notion of 'not too bad' assignments for powering analysis

nodes.name: Edge Violation Probability
nodes.signature: lemma edge_violation_prob : Pr[edge e violated | σ] = UNSAT_local(e, σ)
nodes.description: Probability a random edge is violated relates to local unsatisfiability

nodes.name: Walk Violation Amplifies
nodes.signature: lemma walk_violation_amp : ¬isTypical σ → Pr[t-walk violated] ≥ Ω(√t · UNSAT(G))
nodes.description: Non-typical assignments have many violated t-step walks
nodes.notes: Core of powering analysis; uses expander mixing lemma

nodes.name: Courant-Fischer Theorem
nodes.signature: theorem courant_fischer : λₖ(A) = inf_{dim(V)=k} sup_{v∈V, ‖v‖=1} ⟨Av, v⟩
nodes.description: Variational characterization of eigenvalues
nodes.notes: Standard linear algebra; may exist in mathlib

nodes.name: Operator Norm via Eigenvalues
nodes.signature: lemma operator_norm_eq_spectral_radius : ‖A‖ = max_i |λᵢ(A)|
nodes.description: For symmetric matrices, operator norm equals spectral radius

nodes.name: Perron-Frobenius for Stochastic Matrices
nodes.signature: theorem perron_frobenius_stochastic : λ_max = 1 ∧ unique uniform eigenvector
nodes.description: Largest eigenvalue of regular graph is degree d with uniform eigenvector
nodes.notes: Needed for normalizing random walk matrix

nodes.name: Spectral Decomposition of Walk Matrix
nodes.signature: lemma walk_matrix_decomp : P^t = ∑ᵢ λᵢᵗ · Πᵢ
nodes.description: t-step transition matrix decomposes into eigenspaces

references.section: Markov Chains and Mixing Times, Lemma 12.2

nodes.name: Random Walk Convergence Rate
nodes.signature: lemma convergence_rate : d_TV(P^t(u,·), π) ≤ λ₂^t
nodes.description: Total variation distance to stationary decays exponentially

nodes.name: Cheeger Inequality (Easy Direction)
nodes.signature: lemma cheeger_easy : h(G) ≥ (d - λ₂) / 2
nodes.description: Expansion lower bound from spectral gap (easy direction)

nodes.name: Cheeger Inequality (Hard Direction)
nodes.signature: lemma cheeger_hard : λ₂ ≤ d - h(G)² / (2d)
nodes.description: Spectral gap from expansion (hard direction via sweep cuts)
nodes.notes: Uses sweep cuts and Rayleigh quotient; hardest part of Cheeger

nodes.name: Zig-Zag Product
nodes.signature: def zigzag (G : Graph V) (H : Graph (Fin d)) : Graph (V × Fin d)
nodes.description: Zig-zag graph product for expander construction
nodes.notes: RVW02: Entropy Waves, the Zig-Zag Graph Product

nodes.name: Zig-Zag Preserves Expansion
nodes.signature: theorem zigzag_expansion : λ(G ⊗ H) ≤ f(λ(G), λ(H))
nodes.description: Zig-zag product preserves spectral gap (explicit bound)
nodes.notes: Main RVW theorem; enables explicit expander construction

nodes.name: Iterative Expander Construction
nodes.signature: theorem expander_family_via_zigzag : ∃ family, ∀ n, expands ∧ poly(n) time
nodes.description: Iterate zig-zag to build explicit constant-degree expanders

nodes.name: Fourier Basis on Boolean Cube
nodes.signature: def fourierBasis : (Fin k → Bool) → (Fin k → Bool) → ℚ
nodes.description: Characters χ_S(x) = ∏_{i∈S} (-1)^{x_i} form orthogonal basis

nodes.name: Parseval's Identity
nodes.signature: lemma parseval : 𝔼[f²] = ∑_S f̂(S)²
nodes.description: Energy equals sum of squared Fourier coefficients
nodes.notes: Should follow from orthogonality of characters

nodes.name: BLR Linearity Test
nodes.signature: lemma blr_soundness : dist(f, linear) ≥ ε → Pr[f(x) + f(y) ≠ f(x+y)] ≥ ε
nodes.description: Linearity test rejection probability lower bound
nodes.notes: BLR90 classic linearity testing; foundation for Long Code

nodes.name: Distance to Dictators
nodes.signature: lemma dictator_distance : far_from_dictators → low_weight_on_singletons
nodes.description: Functions far from dictators have small Fourier weight on degree-1 terms
nodes.notes: Uses Parseval and concentration of Fourier mass

nodes.name: Markov Inequality
nodes.signature: lemma markov : Pr[X ≥ a] ≤ 𝔼[X] / a
nodes.description: Basic tail bound for non-negative random variables
nodes.notes: Should be in mathlib; include for graph completeness

nodes.name: Chebyshev Inequality
nodes.signature: lemma chebyshev : Pr[|X - 𝔼[X]| ≥ t] ≤ Var[X] / t²
nodes.description: Concentration via variance
nodes.notes: Should be in mathlib

nodes.name: Hoeffding Inequality
nodes.signature: lemma hoeffding : Pr[|∑ Xᵢ - 𝔼[∑ Xᵢ]| ≥ t] ≤ 2·exp(-2t²/n)
nodes.description: Exponential concentration for bounded independent variables
nodes.notes: Alternative to Chernoff for bounded variables

nodes.name: Hamming Distance
nodes.signature: def hammingDist {n} (x y : Fin n → α) : ℕ
nodes.description: Number of coordinates where vectors differ

nodes.name: Relative Distance
nodes.signature: def relativeDistance (C : LinearCode F n k) : ℚ
nodes.description: Minimum distance normalized by block length

nodes.name: Gilbert-Varshamov Bound
nodes.signature: theorem gilbert_varshamov : ∃ C, relativeDistance C ≥ δ ∧ rate C ≥ 1 - H(δ)
nodes.description: Probabilistic existence of codes achieving GV bound

references.section: The Theory of Error-Correcting Codes, Ch. 17

nodes.notes: Probabilistic method; can be used for good_codes_exist

nodes.name: NP Class Definition
nodes.signature: def NP : Set Language
nodes.description: Languages with polynomial-time verifiable witnesses
nodes.notes: May need to define polynomial-time TM first or use abstract model

nodes.name: 3-Colorability Language
nodes.signature: def ThreeColor : Language
nodes.description: Language of 3-colorable graphs (encoded as bitstrings)

nodes.name: 3-Colorability in NP
nodes.signature: theorem three_color_in_np : ThreeColor ∈ NP
nodes.description: 3-coloring is in NP (witness is the coloring)
nodes.notes: Trivial once NP is defined

workPackages.name: Equivalences & Endgame
workPackages.description: Gap-CSP ⇔ PCP, trivial inclusion, final statement
